intro: Raphionacme splendens, commonly known as the shining raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically bright red or orange. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
